properties.areaDesc: Aiken; McCormick; McDuffie; Kershaw; Chesterfield; Fairfield; Northern Lancaster; Southern Lancaster; Richmond; Lincoln; Newberry; Columbia; Saluda; Lexington; Richland; Edgefield
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 5 at 11:30AM EST until February 7 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...Flash Flood Watch...

.A strong and slow moving cold front will bring heavy
rain to central South Carolina and the Central Savannah River
Area of Georgia Thursday and Thursday night.

The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for parts of east central Georgia and central
South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central
Georgia, Columbia, Lincoln, McDuffie, and Richmond. In central
South Carolina, Aiken, Chesterfield, Edgefield, Fairfield,
Kershaw, Lexington, McCormick, Newberry, Northern Lancaster,
Richland, Saluda, and Southern Lancaster.

* From Thursday morning through late Thursday night

* Soils are near saturation because of the recent wet period.
General rainfall is forecast to be 2 to 3 inches. Locally
higher amounts may occur leading to flash flooding.

* Rapid rises on streams and creeks and in poor-drainage areas may
occur, along with the threat of flooded roads.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

Do not attempt to drive on flooded roads. It takes little
water to move a vehicle off the road and into deeper water.
On foot, keep away from storm drains.

Be cautious near small earthen dams in the region.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
